page.title: 14Onecote wakes
page.content: The Onecote Wakes has only been running for about 5 years - the idea was recently revived. It is held on a Saturday towards the end of August. A band leads a procession from the Jervis Arms car park to the school yard. Behind the band come the Oddfellows, then a dancing troupe and finally the fancy dress competitors. Once at the school the fancy dress competition is judged by the opener who is usually a local well-known person. Around the outside of the school yard there are fund raising stalls and side-shows. Some of the money raised goes to different charities and some is kept in the Onecote Wakes Fund until it is needed for the next wakes.
